numbered_ace_sentences: 3. Elite colleges consider the income of the parents of an applicant.
4. Elite colleges consider whether the parents of an applicant attended the same college.
5. Elite colleges consider whether the parents of an applicant attended an elite school.
6. These factors can affect the likelihood that an applicant is accepted.
7. I wonder why elite colleges base decisions on parental income.
8. I wonder why elite colleges base decisions on where the parents attended school.
9. Parental income does not describe the current applicant.
10. The background of an applicant is not under the control of the applicant.
12. My grades are applicable to elite colleges.
13. The income of my parents can affect my acceptance.
14. The school history of my parents can affect my acceptance.
15. This information is important for me to consider.
16. I am at a disadvantage because of these factors.
17. Many other students are in the same situation.
18. These students have to work harder than more privileged students to get ahead.
19. The headline is: Elite schools throw away elite applicants for family legacies.
